gurmukhi: BUim BrQ Bey prICq prm rUp mhwn ]
transliteration: Bhoom(i) Bharath Bhae Dareechhat Param Roop Mahaan||
translation: After them Parikshat, who was most beautiful and mighty, (their grandson, the son of Abhimanya) became the king of Bharat.

gurmukhi: Aimq rUp audwr dwn AiC`j qyj inDwn ]15]156]
transliteration: Amit Roop Udaar Daan Achhijj Tej Nidhaan||15||156||
translation: He was man of boundless charm, a generous donor and a treasure of invincible glory.15.156.

gurmukhi: sRI igAwn pRboD poQI duqIAw j`g smwpqM ]2]
translation: This is the end of the Second Sacrifice in the book entitled SRI GYAN PRABODH.

gurmukhi: AQ rwjw pRICq ko rwj kQnM ]
transliteration: Ath Raajaa Dareechhat Ko Raaj Kathanan
translation: Here begins the Description of the Rule of the King Parikshat :

gurmukhi: eyk idvs prICqih imil kIXo sMqR mhwn ]
transliteration: Ek Divas Dareechhatah(i) Mil(i) Keeyo Mantra Mahaan||
translation: One day the King Parikshat consulted his ministers;

gurmukhi: gjwmyD su j`g ko ikau kIjIAY svDwn ]
transliteration: Gadaamedh Su Jagg Ko Kiu Keejeeai Savdhaan||
translation: As to how the elephant sacrifice be performed methodically?

gurmukhi: boil boil suimqR mMqRn mMqR kIE ibcwr ]
transliteration: Bol(i) Bol(i) Soumitra Mantran Mantran Keeo Beechaar||
translation: The friends and the ministers who spoke gave the idea;

gurmukhi: syq dMq mMgwie kY bhu jgq so Aibcwr ]1]157]
transliteration: Set Dant Manade Kai Bahu Jagad Su Abichaar||1||157||
translation: That abandoning all other thoughts, the elephant of white teeth be sent for.1.157.

gurmukhi: j`g mMfl ko ricE qih kos Ast pRmwn ]
transliteration: Jagg Mandal Ko Rachio Tah(i) Kos Ast Pramaan||
translation: The sacrificial altar was constructed within eight kos;

gurmukhi: Ast shMsR bulwie ir`quj Ast l`C idjwn ]
transliteration: Ast Sahansra Bulaae Rittuj Ast Lachh Dijaan||
translation: Eight thousand ritual-performing and eight lakh other Brahmins;

gurmukhi: BwNq BwNq bnwie kY qhwN Ast shMsR pRnwr ]
transliteration: Bhaant Bhaant Banaae Kai Tahaan Ast Sahansra Pranaar||
translation: Eight thousand drain of various types were prepared.

gurmukhi: hsq suMf pRmwn qw mih homIAY GiRq Dwr ]2]158]
transliteration: Hast Sound Pramaan Ta Maih Homeeai Ghrit Dhaar||2||158||
translation: Through which the continuous current of the clarified butter of the size of the elephant-trunk flowed.2.158.
